unnormalised: ## Beyond Bollywood: Why Film Festivals Are Your Next Big Thing
normalised: ## Beyond Bollywood: Why Film Festivals Are Your Next Big Thing

unnormalised: Hey cinephiles! Tired of the same old formulaic Bollywood movies? Don't get me wrong, I love a good SRK romance as much as the next person (Darr, anyone?), but sometimes you crave something... different, right? That's where film festivals come in, yaars!
normalised: Hey cinephiles! Tired of the same old formulaic Bollywood movies? Don't get me wrong, I love a good S R K romance as much as the next person (Darr, anyone?), but sometimes you crave something... different, right? That's where film festivals come in, yaars!

unnormalised: Think of film festivals as a giant thali of cinematic delights. You get a little bit of everything: indie films, documentaries that'll blow your mind, foreign films that’ll make you feel super cultured (even if you need subtitles!), and shorts that pack a punch in 15 minutes flat.

unnormalised: We've got some amazing fests right here in India. Imagine yourself chilling in Goa for the International Film Festival of India (IFFI), munching on some vindaloo between screenings. Or perhaps catching some avant-garde cinema at the Kolkata Film Festival, followed by a delicious plate of phuchka. It's a vibe!

unnormalised: But it's not just about the films. Film festivals are also about meeting fellow film lovers. Imagine debating the merits of a particular film with a bunch of strangers over chai at a roadside tapri. The energy is electric!
normalised: But it's not just about the films. Film festivals are also about meeting fellow film lovers. Imagine debating the merits of a particular film with a bunch of strangers over chai at a roadside tapri. The energy is electric!

unnormalised: And let's not forget the networking! If you're an aspiring filmmaker, these festivals are GOLD. You can rub shoulders with industry professionals, attend workshops at FTII- Pune, and maybe even get your film noticed. Who knows, maybe your short film will be the next big thing!

unnormalised: This year, I'm planning to hit up the Mumbai Film Festival (MAMI) in Oct-Nov. Heard there's a great line-up of indie gems. Plus, I'm hoping to snag a selfie with Anurag Kashyap!
normalised: This year, I'm planning to hit up the Mumbai Film Festival (M A M I) in October-November. Heard there's a great line-up of indie gems. Plus, I'm hoping to snag a selfie with Anurag Kashyap!

unnormalised: So, ditch the Netflix binge for a weekend and explore the world of film festivals. You might just discover your new favourite filmmaker or a whole new genre you never knew you loved. And even if you don't, you'll have a fantastic time, guaranteed! Plus, some fests offer student discounts – bonus points! Think of it as an investment in your cultural capital. Worth every rupee! Seriously, go check one out near you; even a small one 50km away. You won't regret it.
